data.meta_description: CAMUS. Francine FAURE, wife of Albert CAMUS. Francine FAURE (1914-1979) was a French mathematics teacher and pianist specializing in Bach. Her father died in the first battle of the Marne in 1914. She married Albert Camus on December 3, 1940, becoming his second wife - 6 Letters A.S. written in the 1940s and addressed to her sister Suzy FAURE, wife CANDEAU. 6 dense letters signed "Francine". She speaks, among others, about Albert CAMUS, Henry de MONTHERLANT, Algeria and the events....
